item.title: 火鸡价格下跌，荷美尔食品公司下调年度销售预期
item.description: Skippy 花生酱生产商荷美尔食品公司（Hormel Foods）周三下调了年度销售预期，原因是受到商品价格下降以及位于弗吉尼亚州的 Planters 品牌生产厂生产中断的影响。【原文：Skippy peanut butter maker Hormel Foods cut its annual sales forecast on Wednesday, hurt by lower commodity prices and a production disruption at its Planters brand manufacturing facility in Virginia.】

item.title: 大众汽车法德国汽车制造商所有权结构解读
item.description: 大众汽车计划关闭在德国的工厂并解除与工会的长期劳资协议，这使其独特的治理和所有权结构成为焦点，多年来，这种治理和所有权结构一直受到投资者的批评。【原文：Volkswagen's plan to close plants in Germany and dissolve long-standing labour agreements with unions has put the spotlight on its unique governance and ownership structure that have drawn criticism from investors for years.】

item.title: 美元树公司因需求疲软下调年度预期
item.description: 折扣店运营商 Dollar Tree 周三下调了年度业绩预期，原因是该公司在通胀严重的情况下，难以吸引对价格敏感的购物者购买利润较高的商品，导致股价在盘前交易中下跌约 9%。【原文：Discount store operator Dollar Tree cut annual forecasts on Wednesday, as it struggled to lure in price-sensitive shoppers for its more profitable higher-margin goods amid sticky inflation, sending shares down about 9% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 消息人士称欧佩克+正在讨论推迟十月石油增产计划
item.description: 欧佩克+组织的三位消息人士周三告诉路透社，由于油价创下9个月来的最低点，该组织正在讨论推迟下个月的增产计划。【原文：OPEC+ is discussing a delay in a planned output increase next month as oil prices hit their lowest in 9 months, three sources from the producer group told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 劳动力数据公布前，经济增长忧虑令期指下滑
item.description: 由于对美国经济健康状况的担忧挥之不去，与华尔街主要指数挂钩的期货在周三晚些时候的劳工数据公布前下滑。【原文：Futures tied to Wall Street's main indexes slipped ahead of labor data expected later on Wednesday as worries lingered about the health of the U.S. economy.】

item.title: 股市下挫，但台积电和三星在大型展会上看好人工智能
item.description: 全球最重要的两家芯片制造商--台湾台积电和韩国三星电子--的高管周三在一个大型贸易展上对人工智能前景表示看好，尽管这两家公司的股票在当天的市场大跌。【原文：Senior executives from two of the world's most important chipmakers, Taiwan's TSMC and South Korea's Samsung Electronics , offered bullish outlooks for artificial intelligence at a major trade show on Wednesday even as their stocks tanked on a fevered day on the markets.】

item.title: 洞察力：可口可乐和百事可乐因加沙问题遭抵制，穆斯林国家的本土苏打水受到影响
item.description: 几十年来，可口可乐公司和竞争对手百事可乐公司花费数亿美元，在穆斯林占多数的国家（包括埃及和巴基斯坦）扩大对其软饮料的需求。【原文：Coca-Cola and rival PepsiCo spent hundreds of millions of dollars over decades building demand for their soft drinks in Muslim-majority countries including Egypt to Pakistan.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，如果 149 亿美元的新日铁交易失败，美国钢铁公司将关闭工厂并搬迁总部
item.description: 华尔街日报》周三援引对美国钢铁公司首席执行官的采访报道称，如果新日铁以 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司的计划失败，美国钢铁公司将关闭工厂，并可能将总部迁出匹兹堡。【原文：U.S. Steel would close mills and likely move its headquarters out of Pittsburgh if the $14.9 billion buyout by Nippon Steel collapses, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday citing an interview with the company's CEO.】

item.title: 早间竞价工厂不景气，股市季节性打喷嚏
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美国东海岸港口工会就工资要求召开会议，为可能的罢工做准备
item.description: 国际码头工人协会（International Longshoremen's Association）工会代表着从得克萨斯州到缅因州主要集装箱港口的 45,000 名工人，将于周三开始为期两天的会议，审查工资要求并为 10 月 1 日可能举行的罢工做准备。【原文：The International Longshoremen's Association union, representing 45,000 workers at major container ports from Texas to Maine, will begin two days of meetings on Wednesday to review wage demands and prepare for a potential strike on Oct. 1.】

item.title: 迪斯尼和 DirecTV 争夺重塑电视捆绑业务
item.description: 高管和专家表示，最初只是卫星电视供应商 DirecTV 为分销沃尔特-迪斯尼（Walt Disney）电视网络所支付费用的例行讨价还价，现在却变成了对捆绑式节目未来的公投。【原文：What began as routine haggling over the rates satellite TV provider DirecTV would pay to distribute Walt Disney's television networks is turning into a referendum on the future of bundled programming, executives and experts said.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，博通测试令人失望，英特尔制造业务受挫
item.description: 三位熟知内情的消息人士告诉路透社，英特尔与芯片制造商博通（Broadcom）的测试失败后，该公司的合同制造业务遭遇挫折，这对该公司的扭亏为盈努力造成了打击。【原文：Intel's contract manufacturing business has suffered a setback after tests with chipmaker Broadcom failed, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters, dealing a blow to the company's turnaround efforts.】

item.title: Vista Energy 将投入超过 10 亿美元用于发展阿根廷页岩技术
item.description: Vista Energy 公司首席执行官告诉路透社，该公司今年将投资约 11 亿美元，目的是发掘更多埋藏在阿根廷一个巨大页岩矿床中的石油资源，同时将成本降低两位数。【原文：In a push to unlock more of the oil riches buried in a massive shale deposit in Argentina, Vista Energy will invest about $1.1 billion this year as it also aims to cut costs there by double digits, the firm's chief executive told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国反垄断审判针对谷歌数字广告业务
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司下周将面临第二起反垄断案件的审判，美国司法部将对这家搜索巨头如何通过一个系统进行广告盈利提出质疑，检察官称该系统损害了新闻出版商的利益。【原文：Alphabet's Google faces trial in a second antitrust case next week where the U.S. Department of Justice will challenge how the search giant monetizes advertising through a system that prosecutors say harms news publishers.】

item.title: 高盛认为哈里斯获胜将为美国经济带来最大推动力
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）认为，以卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）为首的民主党人在今年 11 月的选举中赢得白宫和国会席位，可能会在未来两年为美国经济增长带来最大的推动力。【原文：U.S. economic growth would likely get the biggest boost in the coming two years from the Democrats, headed by Kamala Harris, winning the White House and Congress in this November's elections, according to Goldman Sachs.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局结束对超过 130 万辆通用汽车安全带问题的调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，已结束对通用汽车公司 130 多万辆汽车前排安全带问题的工程分析。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday it has closed an engineering analysis into issues with front seat belt in more than 1.3 million General Motors vehicles.】

item.title: 避险市场面临美国就业测试，日元上涨
item.description: 周三，日元和瑞士法郎兑美元走强，原因是在上一交易日华尔街因对美国经济和科技行业估值的担忧而大幅下挫后，投资者纷纷转向更安全的资产。【原文：The Japanese yen and the Swiss franc firmed against the dollar on Wednesday as investors scurried to safer assets after a sharp selloff on Wall Street in the prior session sparked by concerns about the U.S. economy and tech sector valuations.】

item.title: 星空娱乐与顾问合作最终确定财务业绩，日期尚未确定
item.description: 澳大利亚星际娱乐公司（Star Entertainment）周三表示，该公司正在与各财务顾问合作，以最终确定其 2024 财年的业绩，因为这家陷入困境的赌场运营商仍然因治理和文化问题而受到审查。【原文：Australia's Star Entertainment is working with various financial advisers to finalise its fiscal 2024 results, it said on Wednesday, as the embattled casino operator remains under scrutiny for governance and cultural issues.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，中国基金经理要求员工退还过去五年的超额薪酬
item.description: 两位直接了解此事的人士说，一家中国排名前十的基金管理公司已要求高管退还过去五年中超过新上限的薪酬，以配合政府促进经济平等的举措。【原文：A top 10 Chinese fund manager has asked senior executives to return pay received over the past five years that exceeds a new cap, to tally with a government initiative promoting economic equality, said two people with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 哈里斯通过小型企业税收抵免吸引新罕布什尔州的独立企业
item.description: 民主党总统候选人卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）周三将前往新罕布什尔州，宣布为新成立的小型企业提供5万美元的税收减免，她正努力争取独立选民和对前总统唐纳德-特朗普持怀疑态度的共和党人的支持。【原文：Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris heads to New Hampshire on Wednesday to unveil a $50,000 tax deduction for new small businesses as she works to win over independent voters and Republicans skeptical of former President Donald Trump.】

item.title: Blackstone 将以 160 亿美元的交易收购澳大利亚 AirTrunk
item.description: Blackstone 周三表示，将以超过 240 亿澳元（161.0 亿美元）的隐含企业价值收购澳大利亚数据中心集团 AirTrunk，这将是 Blackstone 在亚太地区最大的一笔投资。【原文：Blackstone will acquire Australian data centre group AirTrunk for an implied enterprise value of over A$24 billion ($16.10 billion), it said on Wednesday, in what would be Blackstone's largest investment in the Asia Pacific region.】

item.title: 出口商面临衰退，德国贸易集团敲响警钟
item.description: 德国出口商协会（BGA）贸易游说团体周三表示，德国出口商正面临着外贸衰退，该行业的前景暗淡得令人担忧。【原文：German exporters are staring down a recession in foreign trade, with sentiment in the sector growing alarmingly dark, the BGA trade lobby group said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧元区 8 月商业活动获得奥运提振，PMI 显示
item.description: 一项调查显示，法国上月举办奥运会，推动了欧元区的商业活动，但由于需求依然疲软，残奥会结束后，欧元区的萎靡不振可能会卷土重来。【原文：Euro zone business activity received a boost from France hosting the Olympic Games last month but the malaise in the bloc is likely to return once the Paralympics wraps up as demand remains weak, a survey showed.】

item.title: 法国服务业采购经理人指数（PMI）显示，法国服务业实现自2022年5月以来最强劲增长
item.description: 周三的一项商业调查显示，受奥运会和需求小幅增长的推动，法国服务业在8月份经历了两年多来最强劲的扩张。【原文：France's services sector experienced its most robust expansion in over two years in August, boosted by the Olympics and a modest rise in demand, a business survey showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 意大利 8 月份服务业采购经理人指数显示增长放缓
item.description: 周三的一项调查显示，在欧元区第三大经济体新业务量下降的情况下，意大利服务业 8 月份出现扩张，但增速低于上月。【原文：Italy's services sector expanded in August but at a slower pace than the previous month, a survey showed on Wednesday, amid a decline in new business in the euro zone's third-largest economy.】

item.title: 科技股估值存疑，外资撤离亚洲股市
item.description: 8 月份，海外投资者积极撤出亚洲科技股，原因是这些股票在近期反弹后价格上涨，而且人们对人工智能投资的盈利能力产生了怀疑。【原文：Overseas investors aggressively withdrew from Asian tech stocks in August, as they turned pricey after their recent rally and doubts emerged about the profitability of AI investments.】

item.title: 国泰航空A350机队维修后将于周六全面复飞
item.description: 香港国泰航空公司周三表示，其空客A350机队将在周六之前全面恢复运营，因为该公司在本周发现有15架飞机的发动机部件在飞行中出现故障，需要对燃油管路进行维修。【原文：Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways said on Wednesday its Airbus A350 fleet would fully resume operations by Saturday after it found 15 planes that needed fuel line repairs following the in-flight failure of an engine part this week.】

item.title: 中国在新一轮基础设施建设中应对风险
item.description: 中国政府周三表示，在努力建设旨在提升制造业水平的新基础设施的同时，中国将应对分散和失衡的风险。【原文：China will address the risks of fragmentation and imbalances as it seeks to build new infrastructure aimed at upgrading its manufacturing sector, the government said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 成本压力持续，澳大利亚消费者将生活必需品放在首位
item.description: 7 月份，澳大利亚家庭优先考虑医疗保健等基本服务支出，在应对顽固通胀和高抵押贷款利率的同时，选择将近期减税带来的额外现金储蓄起来。【原文：Australian households prioritised spending on essential services such as healthcare in July, choosing to save extra cash from recent tax cuts as they grappled with stubborn inflation and high mortgage rates.】

item.title: 市场领头羊转为输家，股市暴跌
item.description: 周三，芯片股拖累亚洲股指走低，欧洲期货市场下跌，此前对经济增长的担忧推动华尔街出现一个月来最大幅度的下挫，投资者将市场宠儿芯片制造商英伟达（Nvidia）的价值抹去了 2,790 亿美元。【原文：Chip shares dragged Asian indexes lower on Wednesday and European futures fell after growth concerns drove the steepest selloff in a month on Wall Street and investors wiped $279 billion from the value of market darling chipmaker Nvidia.】
